title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Crown Holdings Inc

content.text: Crown Holdings Inc goes public and begins trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol CCK.
Crown Holdings Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split, increasing the number of outstanding shares.
Crown Holdings Inc executes a 3-for-2 stock split, further increasing the number of outstanding shares.
Crown Holdings Inc enters the S&P 500 Index, reflecting its growing market capitalization and prominence.
Crown Holdings Inc declares a 2-for-1 stock split, doubling the number of outstanding shares.
Crown Holdings Inc completes a 3-for-2 stock split, increasing the number of outstanding shares.
Crown Holdings Inc acquires Rexam PLC, creating one of the largest packaging companies in the world.
Crown Holdings Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split, increasing the number of outstanding shares.

news.headline: Blackstone-owned Crown faces probe by Victoria's casino regulator
news.summary: (Reuters) -Blackstone-owned Crown Resorts is facing a investigation by an Australian state regulator after the casino operator said it was probing into CEO Ciaran Carruthers, who allegedly overruled the casino's security officers over banning intoxicated customers.  "In relation to the CEO's conduct, the Victorian Gambling and Casino Control Commission (VGCCC) will review the outcome of Crown's investigation into its CEO before determining what, if any, regulatory action may be taken," the sector regulator for the state of Victoria said in a statement on Wednesday.  "The VGCCC had already been aware of a minor being allowed onto the gaming floor and we are actively investigating," VGCCC added.
